intro: Pycnosandra timorensis, commonly known as the Timor sycamore, is a member of the family Anacardiaceae. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 20 meters tall, characterized by its smooth, grey bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits containing several seeds. It is native to the island of Timor and is adapted to tropical climates with well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in the ecological systems of its native habitat.
